_desc.NAICS_DESCRIPTION: Other Farm Product Raw Material Merchant Wholesalers

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
EXECUTIVE SUMMARY                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                     Ag Producers Coop

 501 HW 60 East

 Panhandle, TX 79068

For further information contact: General Manager at 1-806-537-3802



Risk Management Plan - EXECUTIVE SUMMARY



1. The Facility Policy



The owners, management, and employees of Ag Producers Coop are committed to the prevention of any accidental releases of anhydrous ammonia.  If an accidental release should occur, the facility is prepared to work with the local fire company, or other authorities, to mitigate any release and minimize the impact of the release to people and the environment.



2. Facility Information



? Anhydrous ammonia is received, stored, and distributed for direct application for crop production nutrients.  3                              

?The facility has implemented the provisions of "Safety Requirements for the Storage and Handling of Anhydrous Ammonia, Kk-611.1", published by The American National Standards Institute, Inc., and the standards of the U.S. Occupational Safety and Health Administration (OSHA), 29 CFR 1910.111, "Storage and handling of Anhydrous Ammonia".



4. The Five-year Accident History 



a. There have been no accidental releases of anhydrous ammonia in the past five years that:



? Have caused any deaths, injuries, or significant property damage at the facility; nor

? To our knowledge, have resulted in offsite deaths, injuries, evacuations, sheltering in place, property damage, or environmental damage.

- The facility did have a release of product due to an improper pop off valve being installed on a riser connected to  the ammonia storage tank.  Their were no deaths, injuries, or significan

t property damage due to this release.





5. The Emergency Response Program



The facility has:



a. A written Emergency Action Plan, in accordance with OSHA standard, 29 CFR 1910.38;



b. Provided state and local authorities the emergency planning and community right-to-know information as required under SARA Title III (EPCRA).





6. Planned Changes to Improve Safety



Safety improvement is an on-going process at the facility.  Periodic evaluations are performed to assess the maintenance of safe conditions.  There are no additional specific anhydrous ammonia safety recommendations for implementation at this time.
